content.description:
Perfect rock, perfect moves, beautiful setting. Start on the huge obvious jug under the body length roof and reach out the baby head sloper then cross left hand to a small crimp. Work up and left on beautiful finger buckets and top out. This is the best V4 in the park so far. The problem might be harder for shorter climbers.

youtube.com/watch?v=AuMY75m…
content.location: The Zealand is located in the far climbers left of the broken bridge area. It is a big horizontal roof. It has a reinforced landing from a dead tree. The problem looks like a hard V7, but it is actually quite moderate. Start on a big jug rail that goes out to a sloper and then go up the zebra edged wall.

content.description: This climb stands out because of its excellent rock quality. It is tiger stripped. Start on good edges and make a big dyno to obvious spike, then top out.
content.location: Climbers left of the Red Wall, in the middle of the Broken Bridge area.

content.description: A really good route. Start sitting on a cool side pull, grab a crimp and make a big move to a massive jug rail. Make fun moves to the top.
content.location: In a small corridor behind the Glory Hole cave. If you wander around for a minute you will find it.

content.description: Sit start. Grovel up off-width to good jugs and exit left.  A one move wonder in a freak nasty position leads to easy climbing.
The sharp arete to the right of The Grail. Sit start on a pocket below the roof and cut left to crimps on the face.
content.location: on the same boulder as The Grail

content.description:
Basically a V4/5 extension to Glory Hole.  Start sitting as for Glory Hole and then cut left to the overhanging upside down Arête.  Climb this arête to a blocky jug out the roof.  Drop off.

youtube.com/watch?v=jgvR5o5…
content.location: In the Glory Cave, Broken Bridge

content.description:
Climb the perched boulder in the cave next to the Glory Hole.  

  This is a super cool boulder problem that has a couple amazing hand jams, heel-toes, and a knee bar.  

  Start on a jug and slam your feet into the big crack. Climb feet first into hand jams and make the technical and powerful crux top out.
content.location: within the rock-fall cave at the broken bridge. You'll know it when you see it.

content.description: Stand start. Climb the red colored overhanging wall starting on a undercling. Climb two rails to the top.
content.location: Located on the steep red wall.

content.description: Start on the jug rail used for Zealand. make a throw behind you to a good crimp on the lip and crank up to better crimps. To the top!
content.location: Start at the same spot as Zealand but goes up the opposite side of the rock.

content.description:
Start on the big edge and traverse left on hollow sounding, but solid crimps. Finish by climbing up to the jugs half way up the cliff. Going up early drops the grade.  

  a pretty good route despite no top out. If you want to top it out, bring a rope and a brush.
content.location: the 20' vertical face directly in front of the broken bridge and tree crossing.

content.description:
Start on a left hand crimp and right hand gaston. Figure your way up the red and black wall heading towards the hole. A great crimp line in a unique setting. 

  You must climb through the hole!
content.location: Located within the small rock fall cave before you get to the Grail.

content.description: This is a small area of cliff band and boulders right near the Chatfield entrance parking. The cliffs face west and they are right near a little swamp. The rock quality ranges from perfect to flakey, and there is a lot of moss so bring a nylon brush.
